schedule.title: Introduction to Open Source
schedule.description: Sindre gives a quick introduction to Open Source and talks about its benefits, well-known projects, and how to get started.
schedule.image: TODO: path to some image in static dir

schedule.title: Where are the women?
schedule.description: We have looked at the percentage of women in technical roles at NAV IT, and the numbers are not encouraging. Explore the invisible barriers in the IT world and how we can create a more inclusive work environment. Hear directly from women in tech and get five concrete tips for increasing inclusion and well-being for everyone!

schedule.title: Food
schedule.image: TODO: path to some image in static dir

schedule.title: Bluesky & ATProto - The future of social media for the open Internet
schedule.description: Bluesky and ATProto (Authenticated Protocol) want to build an open social network where data flows freely and everyone can participate. This talk provides insights into ATProto and Bluesky, as well as challenges and solutions in federated social networks.
schedule.image: TODO: path to some image in static dir

schedule.title: On Sustainable Packaging for Open Source Modules
schedule.description: Modern open source modules are often packaged in Docker containers, NPM, Maven, or NuGet packages. This makes life significantly easier for both software and platform developers. However, these packages come with a certain amount of overhead. In this presentation, we will examine the implications for the sustainability of our software and what we might be able to do about it.
